name: Vulvodynia
description:
Looking in a medical textbook will tell you the following: Vulvodynia is a chronic, severe vaginal pain with no identifiable cause. While the severe part is dead-on, what a medical textbook won‚Äôt tell you is that Vulvodynia is also the pioneer in what is rapidly becoming South Africa‚Äüs most eviscerating export.
Slamming Brutal Death Metal. With lobotomizing, lurid riffs, skinshredding blast beats and slams gruesome and filthy enough to induce septic shock, Vulvodynia are a lethal plague, spreading throughout the flesh of today‚Äüs heavy music scene‚Äîinfecting one set of ears at a time, and leaving no survivors.

Spawned in 2014 by Vocalist Duncan Bentley and Guitarist Luke Haarhoff, Vulvodynia is a South African slam juggernaut designed with one purpose: to make the craziest, most absurdly heavy music possible, while attempting to define themselves as more than just ‚Äúanother slam band.‚Äù If their mission was over-the-top heaviness, then consider it accomplished‚Äîfrom their debut release, 
Lord of Plagues, Vulvodynia‚Äüs penchant for skull-splitting technicality and eviscerating heaviness has been obvious.

Rapidly gaining popularity and recognition for their prodigal slam 
prowess, Lord of Plagues saw the band reach ears not just in their local scene, but around the world as well. As the band‚Äüs popularity grew, their sound matured, drawing more from a greater array of influences and improving their musicianship and dynamic.
In August 2014 the band signed a two-album contract with Australian Label ‚ÄûVicious Instinct Records‚Äü and added producer Byron Dunwoody in as the second guitarist, in October of 2014, the band released their debut full-length 
album, Cognizant Castigation. If 2014 was the year the band finally grew into their potential, 2015 was the year they shattered their own mold, evolving into an even more aggressive and creative display of no-holds-barred heaviness. The band released a lengthy-but-lurid eight track EP titled Finis Omnium Ignoratium, completing their contract with Vicious Instinct Records. 

No longer satisfied with their status as a terrifying trio, the band sought to expand‚Äîsearching South Africa for more like-minded musicians willing to bring forth brutality. 
Vulvodynia‚Äüs search was not in vain as they found Drummer Thomas Hughes (Fuzigish), Guitarist Kris Xenopoulos 
(Technopath), Bassist Chris Van Der Walt (Boargazm) & Lwandile Prusent to join the band. 

With a full-fledged line-up confirmed, the band made 
their first moves with a signing to the legendary Czech-based label Lacerated Enemy Records. After signing to LE Records the band released their third studio album ‚ÄûPsychosadistic Design‚Äü along with their debut music video for the song ‚ÄûFlesh Tailor‚Äü, The band then embarked on their first EU Tour in 2017 and went abroad twice more for Deathfeast Open Air (DE) & Fall In The Brawl (UK).In 2018 The band embarked on 2 tours through Europe as well as performed at Obscene Extreme Open Air. 2019 saw the band release their 4th studio album ‚ÄòMob Justice‚Äô which sent them touring the US and Australia/New Zealand for the first time as well as 2 Europe tours and a massive festival run.-- proof that there is no way to predict just how far or how fast Vulvodynia‚Äüs sinister infection will spread.

reviewBody: Venue is awesome, great place to see show. As much as I love Vulvodynia, they are not that great live. The drummer really struggles. The new vocalist did fine, it just could have been a lot better. Still love em tho and hope all the best in their future.

Lord of Plagues, Vulvodynia‚Äüs penchant for skull-splitting technicality and eviscerating heaviness has been obvious.

With lobotomizing, lurid riffs, skinshredding blast beats and slams gruesome and filthy enough to induce septic shock, Vulvodynia are a lethal plague, spreading throughout the flesh of today‚Äüs heavy music scene‚Äîinfecting one set of ears at a time, and leaving no survivors.

Spawned in 2014 by Vocalist Duncan Bentley and Guitarist Luke Haarhoff, Vulvodynia is a South African slam juggernaut designed with one purpose: to make the craziest, most absurdly heavy music possible, while attempting to define themselves as more than just ‚Äúanother slam band.‚Äù If their mission was over-the-top heaviness, then consider it accomplished‚Äîfrom their debut release, 
Lord of Plagues, Vulvodynia‚Äüs penchant for skull-splitting technicality and eviscerating heaviness has been obvious.

Rapidly gaining popularity and recognition for their prodigal slam 
prowess, Lord of Plagues saw the band reach ears not just in their local scene, but around the world as well. As the band‚Äüs popularity grew, their sound matured, drawing more from a greater array of influences and improving their musicianship and dynamic.
In August 2014 the band signed a two-album contract with Australian Label ‚ÄûVicious Instinct Records‚Äü and added producer Byron Dunwoody in as the second guitarist, in October of 2014, the band released their debut full-length 
album, Cognizant Castigation. If 2014 was the year the band finally grew into their potential, 2015 was the year they shattered their own mold, evolving into an even more aggressive and creative display of no-holds-barred heaviness. The band released a lengthy-but-lurid eight track EP titled Finis Omnium Ignoratium, completing their contract with Vicious Instinct Records. 

No longer satisfied with their status as a terrifying trio, the band sought to expand‚Äîsearching South Africa for more like-minded musicians willing to bring forth brutality. 
Vulvodynia‚Äüs search was not in vain as they found Drummer Thomas Hughes (Fuzigish), Guitarist Kris Xenopoulos 
(Technopath), Bassist Chris Van Der Walt (Boargazm) & Lwandile Prusent to join the band. 

With a full-fledged line-up confirmed, the band made 
their first moves with a signing to the legendary Czech-based label Lacerated Enemy Records. After signing to LE Records the band released their third studio album ‚ÄûPsychosadistic Design‚Äü along with their debut music video for the song ‚ÄûFlesh Tailor‚Äü, The band then embarked on their first EU Tour in 2017 and went abroad twice more for Deathfeast Open Air (DE) & Fall In The Brawl (UK).In 2018 The band embarked on 2 tours through Europe as well as performed at Obscene Extreme Open Air. 2019 saw the band release their 4th studio album ‚ÄòMob Justice‚Äô which sent them touring the US and Australia/New Zealand for the first time as well as 2 Europe tours and a massive festival run.-- proof that there is no way to predict just how far or how fast Vulvodynia‚Äüs sinister infection will spread.
